title: Riot, stop listening to your community in terms of Champion Balance
body:
The repetitive cycle is always there. A champion performs well in LCS, some fanboy of the losing team that lost due to said champion is then roaring about how said champion is supposedly OP, attracting more of the fanboys before creating a hive mind through upvotes since the community mindlessly follows. Champion is then nerfed, and after a couple of months, the same people are demanding to revert the changes, which rarely happens. 

The majority of the player base do not know what they are talking about, they should not have a voice in the matter (Looking at you Gameplay & Balance and Reddit) cause they have been tarnishing champions due to their ignorance in forms of bandwagons.

I don't the Lee has ever really been THE best jungler at any point in time. He may have largely defined who could and could not jungle based on who could survive his once dominant (but no longer) early game, but I don't think he's unequivocally ever been the undisputed best jungler. He has always been very popular and dangerous early, which forces other junglers to adapt to his presence, but he's never really been the best pick. Hell, even for Season 5, Reksai, Vi, J4, and even Pantheon were all far better warrior junglers than he was. He's just been a solid, popular pick for a long time that can make big plays but also has many, many weaknesses that people, for some reason, refuse to acknowledge.

Well the community does have one legitimate concern when it comes to "meta" vs "non-meta" champions.  Only so many of the total champions in game are used in LCS:  That is for a reason.


Therefore the balance of the "unused" ones such as {{champion:114}}  of course are real discussions.  Dismissing the community out of hand and calling them "NOOBS" simply because they are not best at logical argumentation does not discount the underling truths that they are right of course.


Also you forget that in the end it doesn't matter what RIOT wants:  If the playerbase /quit or otherwise no new players enter due to imbalances a game is over.  So many video games have fallen, especially PvP games (looking at you Elder Scrolls Online) so fast due to such imbalances.  The burden of proof that "something is balanced" befalls on RIOT, not the community.
